post.body: I got ya beat, Robin. It's 20 degrees here in Pennsylvania. :)
@Relz I think we should all message Rel sometime when it's 1 am down under so she gets all the messages when she wakes up! Ha!
You are making me hungry!
I'm looking forward to reading that book a lot!
I'm really enjoying my new Living translation (2nd ed.) Bible. I've always had NIV, but this is really eye-opening.
Tricia twittering away on her phone/computer... Ha! LOL. People watching is fun, isn't it?
Yep. I agree! James Scott Bell books rock. :) What's your favorite?
Reply was sent... :)
That was cute. I like the deer's little tail twitching. LOL.
Make it $3.00 and I'll be knocking on your door in five minutes. Ha!
Oh, please ... why did you have to mention Starbucks? Peppermint flavoring is wonderful in a coffee drink.
@barbarascott I would LOVE to see the final covers. That's such a fun aspect of the whole publishing-a-novel process. :)
I second that you read it somewhere. Ha ha.
Yes, that's a good suggestion on the Myers-Briggs. I always try to pick who I am, but it's hard to judge yourself sometimes!
You bet!
I love Barbara Stanwick! No one did it like her. :)
It sure is!!! What a great Christmas gift, eh? :)
I love Plumb! Can't wait to hear it, Matt.
I have a table tree this year because of this problem but miss the full tree. Will have to try this! Thank you!
Thanks for the chat you did at Abunga. I came in late but got to ask you the Q about how you know when to start writing. :)
I liked the Isaiah 40:31 shirt. Not too in your face, but could start some conversations. :)
@Relz @TWCP @christaallan My character is supposed to be early twenties so I'll be able to use this as a guide for just me. :)
@Relz @TWCP @christaallan Thanks for taking the time to look at the photo and comment. I appreciate it!
@DarcieJoy Thanks, ladies! This works great then. I needed a character who could be in her early twenties.
Thanks! I'm looking for approximately 23, so this might work. It's just to help me have a pic of the character.
Every time I take the Myers Briggs test I end up a different personality. Is that a good thing or a bad thing? :)
Wonder how many people did? Hopefully the word will get out before too many accounts are compromised!
Scared me for a minute there. I'm glad I didn't log in.
Thanks, reflective. I had a feeling it was bad. Glad I didn't log in. I shouldn't have even clicked on it. Knew better! Ha.
I'm being told it's a Phishing scam, so don't log in once you get to that page. Only go to Twitter directly yourself.
Thanks! I'm not sure where Ace lives, but here's his website link: http://www.acecollins.com/ Zondervan is his pub for Farraday...
I agree. It deserved those awards/nominations. Dialogue was standout. I noticed how Newman sidestepped questions.
Yeah, cuz you run out of material way too soon!
Wow! You are an amazingly fast reader. :)
Great! Thanks for asking. About to continue working on my third novel. :)
No problem at all, Ronie. Just thought I'd check. :) Hope your writing is going well!
I don't think I am, but I'll go check. I log on from the web.
My latest interview, this time with Robin Shope -- interesting! http://tinyurl.com/5z7e7s
We're giving away the complete Family Honor series by @karenball1 at TitleTrakk this week! Check it: http://www.titletrakk.com/contests.htm
Fiction writers take note - how to stretch tension: http://tinyurl.com/6czt3b
The peak of the Geminids meteor shower is tonight: http://tinyurl.com/2mhely
Can't believe it's already the weekend. Seems the week flew by! Guess that's a good thing? :)
New! James Scott Bell - Stretching the Tension Part 1: http://tinyurl.com/5o599r
Great info from @michaelhyatt -- Getting Things Done Update: http://tinyurl.com/6fbgyu
Trying to balance online time with family, spiritual & writing. I've done a poor job lately. :( Any suggestions on how you stay balanced?
Doing some research on true first edition copies of Anne of Green Gables (1908) for novel. Did you know one sold for $12,000 recently?
Just came inside after playing with the dogs in snow. They had a blast, and so did I! Brings out the kid in me. :)
Finishing up Christmas cards! Didn't realize I'd have so many here... :)
I am trying to find a photo of a particular aged girl to use for my WIP
How old do you think this girl is: http://tinyurl.com/4lgzjh
Am hoping to get done with day job work early today so I can do some more brainstorming on my novel. We'll see!
Pls RT @cjdarlington The "check out this funny blog post about you" dm w/ jannawalitax.blogspot link is possible PHISH. Don't log in!
Am I the only DMed about some blog called jannawalitax.blogspot.com? I clicked on the link, sent me back here. Am concerned it's bad.
Just posted: My interview with author Ace Collins: http://tinyurl.com/a5263m
Mission for women needs books! Care to donate? Find out more: http://tinyurl.com/99kedf
Has anyone else noticed a slowdown of interest at Shoutlife? I rarely get hits from it now, and I'm wondering if it's worth updating.
Just finished watching the movie Absence of Malice (1981) starring Paul Newman & Sally Field. Pretty good.
RT for @brandilyn BREAKING NEWS ON KATY & LIZ: Good Morning America wants to have Katy on their show. Updates on: http://is.gd/736q
New e-book resource for character first novelists: http://tinyurl.com/98dg2w
Homeless blogging teen featured on two local news stations! http://tinyurl.com/7he46x
